content.description:
Stone Cold Heads goes straight out the middle of the Sex Cave.  Move through two chipped pockets into a strenuous slot that allows some interesting heel-toe jamming.  Make the clip and move up onto some slopers for a marginal rest.  From the rest, you move up and right onto the rail, and then into the same, very stout, finish as

Rubble

.  Despite the chipped start, this is a great, relentless line on good stone.  This could also be sent natural by traversing in from the left, using a sharp, black pocket.
content.protection: 7 bolts to a two bolt anchor - the route usually has in situ draws on it and the last bolt is now equiped with a chain draw

content.description:
This is an obvious linkup. Climb the first crux of

Stone Cold Modern

with its chipped pockets and over-the-head trickery, then finish with the crux of

Head Like A Hole

.  This is a bit easier than the original straight up finish but is much more enjoyable overall!
content.protection: Bolts.  Currently all the draws are fixed and there are fixed biners on the anchors.
content.location: Right out the center of the Sex Cave....

content.description:
Rubble Head is a quality Sex Cave link-up that climbs through the challenging start of

Rubble

and then continues straight up to finish on

Head Like a Hole's

final crux.

Since one of the holds in the upper crux of

Stone Cold Modern

has broken, this link-up climbs at a similar (or slightly easier) grade as originally suggested for the left finish. The left finish, or original finish, is now slightly harder.
content.location: It is the rightmost route to the right finish.

content.description: Rubble climbs out the very center of the Sex Cave. A stout boulder problem leads to a slot (good kneebar rest) and more steep climbing. There is a very hard move at the end. All natural and very overhung, it's one of the best testpieces in the canyon.

This is the easiest route at the Sex Cave.  It goes at 12d if you use the "scary block" beta for the moves between bolts 2 and 3, keeping this section at 5.11.  Or you can bypass this hold which requires a 5.12 move that adds to the overall difficulty of the route (5.13a).  The "scary block" is not all that scary and couldn't come out unless you go up there with a  crowbar, but since there is a reference to it in the guide I thought it should be mentioned.

Head Like a Hole is quite a sustained route, with a very tricky clipping crux near the end of the cave section, followed by a slightly runout 12a/b finish on the face.  Falling here will only result in a great swing due to the overhang, but the runout does make you think a little bit. Overall a worthy route that will keep you on your toes.

This is another contrived link up that's probably been done but fun nonetheless. The name is what we called it, but others might have called it something else.

Follow the first 3 bots on

Head Like a Hole

. Then finish on

Stone Cold Modern's

stiff top out. It is fun and something else to do if you only want to climb the unchipped rock and you're spending too much time at the cave.

climbs.name: The Freezer aka Fridge aka Dr. Duck
climbs.fa: C. Fryberger, 2004? Jered Bernert, 2010? T. Camillieri

content.description: There is a large boulder across from the parking lot for the Sex Cave. Starts down low on a jug on the right arete. Slap your way up to the lip. Exit right for the PG-13 variation or over the top for a little spice.
content.protection: Life jacket if planning on trying it in the summer ;)
content.location: This is across the river from the Sex Cave. It's the very obvious double arete on the up-creek side of the block.
